I will download this cause I do windXP pro installations all the time... ,so I need to save time with future updates.


@ All new users : 

       It is always preferable , always to do a clean installation from the beginning. That means that if you want to change from win98,winXP Home edition,winVista or whatever operating system you have, to winXP Pro edition or what ever ''new'' operating system you want to have , first backup your personal data , collect the drivers for your motherboard,sound/vga card,camera,printer,wireless adapters e.t.c , and after that do partition/format your hard drive before you install your ''new'' operating system. 

  Note that some windows/torrents that do not need cd key and/or activation , will NOT work if you just upgrade. You will have to format your hard drive first ...e.t.c e.t.c

@ Those people that they do have problems making bootable cd/dvd disks :

    1) Always burn your disks using slow speeds
    2) If your disk doesn't work , try buying a new empty disk from a different company/trademark. Always try CD/DVD-R and CD/DVD+R because believe it or not, sometimes it does matter for your recording device and/or the device of the system that will try to boot it. Also try different software.
    3) If you don't try to download a torrent and test it by yourself, you can NOT be 100% sure about it. Pirated software is not always ''easy'' and of course sometimes is very easy and you save money... 
    4) Try to ''google'' and learn what is ''Fake virus warnings'' ,you will save energy and you will ''protect'' your nerves! LOL
